intro: Heteropterys purpurea f. typica, commonly known as the purple beautyberry, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are highly ornamental and attract wildlife. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, shady environments. Its foliage is typically dark green with a glossy texture, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
